self.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

classes.description: The majority of observations collected during a study can be divided among three general classes: Interventions, Events, or Findings.  Datasets based on any of the general observation classes share a set of common Identifier and Timing variables. As a general rule, any valid Identifier or Timing variable is permissible for use in any submission dataset based on a general observation class. (Source: SDTM v1.4, Section 2.2)
classes.label: General Observation Class
classes.name: General Observations

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)
SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DI.SPDEVID

datasetVariables.description: It must be unique for each tracked unit of the device under study, and can be at whatever level of granularity the device should be identified (e.g., model or serial number, or combination of identifiers).
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor Device Identifier
datasetVariables.name: SPDEVID

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DI.DISEQ

datasetVariables.description: If there is only one value for DIPARMCD for each value of SPDEVID, then DISEQ will be 1 for all records. DISEQ must be a valid number.
datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: DISEQ

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DI.DIPARMCD

datasetVariables.description: Examples: SERIAL, MODEL.  A record with DIPARMCD = TYPE should be included (see below)
datasetVariables.label: Device Identifier Element Short Name
datasetVariables.name: DIPARMCD

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DI.DIPARM

datasetVariables.description: Examples: Serial Number, Model.  A record with DIPARM = Type should be included (see below)
datasetVariables.label: Device Identifier  Element Name
datasetVariables.name: DIPARM

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DI.DIVAL

datasetVariables.description: Value for the parameter.  When DIPARM = Type, DIVAL should be a value in the GMDN dictionary (see below)
datasetVariables.label: Device Identifier Element Value
datasetVariables.name: DIVAL

datasets.description: A special-purpose domain containing information that identifies a specific device unit. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C102618, 2018-06-29)
datasets.label: Device Identifiers
datasets.name: DI

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.

datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DR.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DR.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Required as the purpose of this domain is to link each USUBJID to one or more devices.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DR.SPDEVID

datasetVariables.description: It must be unique for each tracked unit of the device under study, and can be at whatever level of granularity the device should be identified (e.g., model or serial number, or combination of identifiers) as defined in DI.
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor Device Identifier
datasetVariables.name: SPDEVID

datasets.description: A special-purpose domain that contains the linkage of each subject to the device(s) to which they may have been exposed during the study. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C102620, 2018-06-29)
datasets.label: Device-Subject Relationships
datasets.name: DR

classes.description: This SDTM class contains a set of domains which do not conform to the Findings, Events or Interventions observation classes. The domains included are DM, CO, SE and SV. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103377, 2018-06-29)
classes.label: Special-Purpose Datasets
classes.name: Special-Purpose

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUGRPID

datasetVariables.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject or a group of subject related records. Example: group records specifying all the settings for a specific imaging scan, such as field strength, repetition time and echo time.

modelClassVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUTESTCD

datasetVariables.description: It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in DUTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g."1TEST"). DUTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: COILSTR, CNTMEDIA.
datasetVariables.label: Device In-Use Test Short Name
datasetVariables.name: DUTESTCD

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C106482

modelClassVariable.title: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUTEST

datasetVariables.description: The value in DUTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: Coil Strength, Contrast Media.
datasetVariables.label: Device In-Use Test Name
datasetVariables.name: DUTEST

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUCAT

datasetVariables.description: For example, it can be used to define the type of device for which settings are recorded if DI is not used, for example, if the device is not under study.  Alternatively, it could record the type of setting, e.g., HARDWARE vs. SOFTWARE
datasetVariables.label: Category for Device In-Use
datasetVariables.name: DUCAT

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUSCAT

datasetVariables.description: For example, if DUCAT = SOFTWARE, DUSCAT might be NOMINAL or POST-ADJUSTMENT.
datasetVariables.label: Subcategory for Device In-Use
datasetVariables.name: DUSCAT

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUORRES

self.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

datasetVariables.description: DUORRES should contain the setting or other device condition in effect at the time the device was used.
datasetVariables.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
datasetVariables.name: DUORRES

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUORRESU

datasetVariables.label: Original Units
datasetVariables.name: DUORRESU

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUSTRESC

datasetVariables.description: DUSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in DUSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in DUORRES, and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in DUSTRESC as "NEGATIVE".
datasetVariables.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
datasetVariables.name: DUSTRESC

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUSTRESN

datasetVariables.description: Is copied in numeric format from DUSTRESC. DUSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
datasetVariables.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: DUSTRESN

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUSTRESU

datasetVariables.description: The unit for standardized results may or may not be the same as for the original results.
datasetVariables.label: Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: DUSTRESU

datasetVariables.name: DUDY

datasets.description: A findings domain that contains the measurements and settings that are intentionally set on a device when it is in use. These are characteristics that exist for the device, and have a specific setting for a use instance. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C102622, 2018-06-29)
datasets.label: Device In-Use
datasets.name: DU

datasets.description: A findings domain that contains the device characteristics that do not vary over the course of the study. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C102619, 2018-06-29)

classes.description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2018-06-29)
classes.label: Findings Observation Class
classes.name: Findings

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DX.DXDUR

datasetVariables.description: Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times.
datasetVariables.label: Duration of Device Exposure

datasets.description: An interventions domain that contains a subject's exposure to a medical device under study. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C102617, 2018-06-29)
datasets.label: Device Exposure
datasets.name: DX

classes.description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2018-06-29)
classes.label: Interventions Observation Class
classes.name: Interventions

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)
SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

datasets.datasetStructure: One record per event per device

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.STUDYID

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Expected rather than required because events may happen to or with a device that do not involved subjects, and may even be before the device was in contact with a subject.  In these cases there may not be a value for USUBJID.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.SPDEVID

datasetVariables.description: It must be unique for each tracked unit of the device under study, and can be at whatever level of granularity the device should be identified (e.g., model or serial number, or combination of identifiers).
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor Device Identifier
datasetVariables.name: SPDEVID

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DESEQ

datasetVariables.description: May be any valid number.  It should be unique within every subject/device combination.  If there is no USUBJID associated with the event, DESEQ should be unique within each SPDEVID.
datasetVariables.label: Device Events Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: DESEQ

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DESPID

datasetVariables.description: Perhaps pre-printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database.  Note that it does not have to be numeric.
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariables.name: DESPID

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DETERM

datasetVariables.description: Examples: Screw Breakage, Fissure Formation, Battery Issue
datasetVariables.label: Reported Term for Device Event
datasetVariables.name: DETERM

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DEMODIFY

datasetVariables.description: If DETERM is modified, then the modified text is placed here.
datasetVariables.label: Modified Device Event Name
datasetVariables.name: DEMODIFY

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DEDECOD

datasetVariables.label: Device Events Dictionary-Derived Term
datasetVariables.name: DEDECOD

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

datasetVariables.description: For example, MALFUNCTION vs. CALIBRATION

datasetVariables.description: For example, EXTERNAL vs. INTERNAL
datasetVariables.label: Subcategory of  Device Event

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DEPRESP

datasetVariables.description: For example, DETERM could contain a list of malfunctions that are being specifically evaluated.  DEPRESP would identify those (Y), while any spontaneous events would have DEPREST = null.
datasetVariables.label: Pre-Specified Device Event
datasetVariables.name: DEPRESP

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DESTAT

datasetVariables.description: For example, if equipment operation requires checking, such as checking an event log to detect events. Capturing that the checks were not completed may be relevant to interpreting the study data.

datasetVariables.name: DESTAT

datasetVariables.description: Terms Describing Severity of Event (e.g., the severity of a Malfunction)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DEACNDEV

datasetVariables.description: Example: Shipped, Returned, Installed, Implanted, Explanted
datasetVariables.label: Reported Term for the Tracking Event
datasetVariables.name: DTTERM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DT.DTMODIFY

datasetVariables.name: DTMODIFY

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DT.DTDECOD

datasetVariables.name: DTDECOD

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DT.DTPARTY

datasetVariables.description: Describes the person or organization that is accountable for the device defined in DTTERM. For example: if DTTERM = SHIPPED, DTPARTY would contain the transfer recipient, e.g., SITE. If DTTERM = IMPLANTED then DTPARTY would contain SUBJECT.
datasetVariables.label: Party Responsible  for the Device
datasetVariables.name: DTPARTY

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DT.DTPRTYID

datasetVariables.description: The value of the responsible party identified in DTPARTY. For example, if DTPARTY is SUBJECT, DTPRTYID would contain the subject number.
datasetVariables.label: Responsible Party Identifier
datasetVariables.name: DTPRTYID

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

datasetVariables.description: Examples: categorize by tracking event type, for example, DOMESTIC vs. INTERNATIONAL

datasetVariables.name: DTCAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DT.DTSCAT

datasetVariables.description: A further categorization of the event.
datasetVariables.label: Subcategory for Device Tracking Event
datasetVariables.name: DTSCAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DT.DTDTC

self.title: Date/Time of Device Tracking Event Collection

datasetVariables.description: Will generally be the same as the date the tracking event started, but it can differ.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Device Tracking Event Collection
datasetVariables.name: DTDTC

parentProduct.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DT.DTSTDTC

self.title: Start Date/Time of Device Tracking Event

datasetVariables.description: A tracking event (e.g., SHIPPED, RECEIVED) is usually a point in time, which is why only the start date/time is included.  If an event occurs over a longer period, the stop date/time may be included from the SDTM model.
datasetVariables.label: Start Date/Time of Device Tracking Event
datasetVariables.name: DTSTDTC

datasets.description: A events domain that contains the logistics and disposition information specific to a given device. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C102621, 2018-06-29)
datasets.label: Device Tracking and Disposition
datasets.name: DT

classes.description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2018-06-29)
classes.label: Events Observation Class
classes.name: Events

description: This provisional Medical Device Implementation Guide (IG) to the Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM) defines recommended standards for the submission of data from clinical trials in which medical devices were used, and is referred to as the SDTMIG-MD.
label: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)
name: SDTMIG-MD v1.0
source: Prepared by the CDISC Device Team
